name: wieldy
content:
wieldy adjective
(EASY TO MOVE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
easy to move or operate: A small, wieldy camper van can be a good replacement for a large family car. The officers were issued new handheld radios, which were slimmer and much more wieldy than the kind they had been using before.
More examplesFewer examplesThis new car is more wieldy around town and in tight spaces.This suitcase is less wieldy than the one you have because it doesn't have wheels on the bottom. I found it easy to drive and surprisingly wieldy in heavy traffic.

wieldy adjective
(EASY TO MANAGE)
effective or easy to manage, because of being small and well organized enough: Nobody knows how much information can be stored, while still remaining somehow wieldy. By a process of elimination, the research team arrived at a more wieldy number of possible solutions.
